thinking.disposable_income: Chatham has a median household income of approximately $34,962, significantly below Chicago's median. About 23% of residents live below poverty level, indicating limited disposable income for many households
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Given the lower income levels, residents have limited discretionary spending capacity. Many households spend a significant portion of income on essential needs, making them sensitive to additional transportation costs and sales taxes
thinking.accessibility: Chatham has good access to public transit with Red Line stations and multiple bus routes. About 33% of households don't own vehicles and rely on public transit. The community has a high proportion of commuters using public transportation
thinking.decision_rationale: 1. Prioritize lower transit fares due to income constraints and high transit dependency. 2. Moderate sales tax to balance revenue needs with household budget impacts. 3. Support driving fees to improve transit service while considering car-owning households. 4. Focus on proposals that reduce transit travel time to improve accessibility. 5. Balance between transit improvement and cost burden on residents. Selected proposals that offer reduced transit fares with moderate tax increases and driving fees to improve service while maintaining affordability
